page.title: 01 The Town of Seaton
page.content: { Seaton,}first inhabited by the Romans is now a popular seaside resort.It is twinned with Thury Harcourt.Seaton has a population of less than five thousand but this is more than doubled in the summer. On the east end of the promenade is the River Axe beyond which are cliffs on which there is a fine golf course.At the west end of the beach is Seaton Hole.Here at the base of the high white cliffs,which separates Seaton from the village of Beer,are many rock pools containing a lot of marine life. From the beach can be seen Portland Bill to the east, and to the South West you can follow the coastline to Torbay. Close to Seaton are many places of great interest.Bindon Manor in the 14th century is mentioned in the Domesday Book.{(see page 9) }
